creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: clock; long, narrow rectangular white porcelain slab with waving edges; top and bottom edges curl gently upward; blue chrysanthemum pattern throughout--just a few at bottom and top edges, but gather in intensity, becoming very intense around clock face; round clock face is made of gold foil; white porcelain droplet at top and bottom center of clock face; white porcelain thorn shaped protrusion on either side of clock face, attached on outside edge of porcelain slab, one pointed upward, one pointed downward; clock is mounted on two horizontally oriented soft blocks, one at top and one at bottom
inscription: Japanese inscription center back of clock, written on adhered paper
markings: LLC of inscribed paper, red stamp; Clark sticker attached to inside bottom support
signed: bottom center, in black, in Japanese; written with inscription on adhered paper, in Japanese
title: Clock with Chrysanthemum Pattern
